definition: ocean/sea/CL:個|个[ge4],片[pian4]/great number of people or things/(dialect) numerous

home/family/(polite) my (sister, uncle etc)/classifier for families or businesses/refers to the philosophical schools of pre-Han China/noun suffix for a specialist in some activity, such as a musician or revolutionary, corresponding to English -ist, -er, -ary or -ian/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: The reputation of the navigator is under assault from historical revisionists.
sentences.chinese: 这位航海家的名誉受到了历史修正主义者的攻击。

sentences.english: He is a real great navigator.
sentences.chinese: 他真是个伟大的航海家。

sentences.english: The winds and waves are always on the side of the ablest navigators.
sentences.chinese: 狂风和巨浪永远站在最精明强干的航海家一边。

sentences.english: The museum presents things the voyagers used as well as the remains of the raft.
sentences.chinese: 博物馆内藏有航海家们用过的东西以及筏的残骸。

sentences.english: French yachtsman has broken the record for sailing round the world single-handed.
sentences.chinese: 一名法国航海家打破了环游世界的世界纪录。

sentences.english: The winds and waves are always on the side of the ablest navigators .
sentences.chinese: 狂风和巨浪永远站在最精明强干的航海家一边。

sentences.english: Pius Mau Piailug, master navigator, died on July 12th, aged 78
sentences.chinese: 航海家，于七月十二日逝世，终年78岁。

sentences.english: The winds and the waves are always on the side of the ablest navigators.
sentences.chinese: 天风海涛永远站在最能干的航海家那边。

definition: Cristóbal Colón or Christopher Columbus (1451-1506)/Columbus, capital of Ohio
Captain James Cook (1728-1779), British navigator and explorer
Hispaniola (Caribbean Island divided between Dominican Republic and Haiti)
Calicut, town on Arabian sea in Kerala, India
